name: Days Inn Orlando International Drive South of Universal

reviews.title: had a great stay here.
reviews.text: The reviews about this hotel being a dump are totally wrong, I stayed here for 2 weeks with my partner & we found the hotel to be clean and receptionists to be very helpful.
The location is good as it is only a 10 minute walk to Universal Studios & the free transport is particularly good if you havent rented a car.
reviews.title: It's an Airtours Hotel--What do you want?

reviews.text: We stayed just as the hotel was changing to a Days Inn & obviously stayed in one of the rooms that hadnt been renovated, but this room was one of the best rooms we have stayed in for such a low price. I would think now that they have renovated all the rooms they would only be better!
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.text: The cafe & laundry room is also very handy. I would without a doubt stay again if I was going to Orlando.
reviews.title: this hotel is fine
**Name Change-again!**
reviews.text: My wife and I have just come back, and there is no problem with the Hotel.

reviews.title: Good Value For Money
reviews.text: After reading many BAD reviews of this hotel I was quite concerned and dreading my arrival. Bearing in mind we only paid £131 for 7 nights I was very worried and my expectations weren't too high.. However, I have to say that our stay was very pleasant. The rooms have recently been re-decorated, but this is a budget hotel so its not exactly modern taste however, it was clean. The cleaner came in every day, changed the towels and cleaned the room. All staff were very friendly. This hotel is in an excellent location for Universal Studios, Interstate 4 and all shopping malls. Very easy access from Sanford and Orlando international airport. We were purely in orlando for shopping prior to christmas and wanted to make the trip as cheap as possible. I was happy with our stay for the money we paid. If you are expecting 5 star accomodation - Do not book this hotel as you will be disappointed and will leave bad reviews.. if you just want a base for the end of a hard day thats basic and clean and cheap with it - then this is perfect!

reviews.title: Stay off the Kirkman Road side
reviews.text: The hotel was decent. I only paid $45 per night for the room so my expectations weren't too high. The problem I had was the room location in the facility. My room was on the 4th floor overlooking a Chevron station and Kirkman Road at the intersection of International Drive. Friday and Saturday night the parking lot of the Chevron station was used as a gathering place for people blasting music into the early morning. The stop light at Kirkman Road and International Drive was a staging light for motorcycle racing that created an immense amount of noise as the engines of the bikes were approaching 10,000 RPM. At 1:30 AM I couldn't take it anymore. I called the desk and ask them to get me a different room. Luckily they did have a room on the inside of the facility on the first floor near the pool. That room was much quieter and I did get a little rest.

My other complaint was a security issue. On both rooms the safety "chain" that prevents the door from being opened even if you have a key was missing the part that attaches to the door rendering the lock useless.
reviews.title: Hate doing this but...
Days Inn
reviews.text: Stayed here on oct 7th,first room stunk of dampness,security lock on door was busted open,safe was hanging off the wall and the bath was filthy.Complained and was allocated a 2nd room which was a carbon copy of the first with an even stronger stink of dampness.Also felt very unsafe with some undesirables hanging around outside. The other thing that i thought was out of order was the 52 dollar charge for use of a safe that didn,t look entirely safe?.After complaining to airtours the next morning myself and my family were moved to a far better hotel on i-drive.On the 3rd day we met another 2 couples who had been shifted from the same place due to similar problems to ourselves.In fairness they did appear to be doing the place up,but it seemed to be more of an external paint job than anything with the actual rooms.I hate writing this as i have stayed in lots of hotels over the years and realise that peoples liveliehoods play a part but i honestly can not give this place a better review than this,sorry.

me and my boyfriend have just come back from staying at this hotel for 2 weeks, however the rooms are basic and if u are not completly satisfied with your rooms they will move u to a new room and normally with a few extra perks, we did know a few people who had to move rooms for some problems but nothing that the hotel were not willing to move them for, the hotel is being done up at the moment, so once they get around to doing all the rooms i think this hotel would be very nice, when i was there, they were very basic but very clean and tidy, fresh towels every day and if u leave a couple of dollors for the maid she will normally leave a few extra towels for u. the pool was nice not massive but then not tiny at the same time, was clean and tidy and lots of things for the kids to play with.if your on the ground floor watch out for the cockroaches and just ask the maid to put stuff down for you, or move rooms to a higher floor.
reviews.title: Are you sure you are writing about the correct Days Inn!!!!

reviews.text: to begin with i have got to say the location was fab. but i have written this review to tell you that the hotel was awful. in the room the carpet was wet and it smelled like tropical juice but it was not that bad . but do not eat in the breakfast bar. the food was horrible and the people who worked there were arrogant.
reviews.title: this hotel was a bit smelly

reviews.text: Ok so the room was very basic but it was clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They ran shuttle buses to all the major parks which always turned up (even if they were slightly late). The hotel was centrally located for everything on International Drive. We felt very safe in our room and even ventured out at night. The maid service came everyday beds were made and clean towels left. The safe in the room is complimentary and the key is left on top of it so you just put your valuables in lock it and keep the key with you no charge. After reading most of the reviews on here I felt ill and did not look forward to arriving for my holiday but when we did arrive I breathed a huge sigh of relief it was not as bad as I had been lead to believe. Our room faced out onto International Drive looking at the Crazy golf opposite. We were on the main road but did not have a problem with any noise. The swimming pool is small but most people are out at the parks everyday so you find it is not too crowded. The Deli downstairs is great for Breakfast.
reviews.title: Do not panic it's not that bad
Listen to the bad reports this place is awful
reviews.text: Please do not let any reviews worry you if you have booked this hotel. After the holiday I've just had I can assure you that you will not be in your room that much only to crawl into at the end of a day spent being thrown up and down and turned upside down on Rollercoasters I can honestly say I would stay here again.

Days inn on i drive is awful sadly we read bad reviews after we had booked it and went hoping they were wrong ... THEY WEREN'T !!! we had wall paper hanging off the wall, no plug in the bath ( something i wanted after a 9 hr flight and coach transfer ) the room was dark and very un welcoming and the tv didnt work well. we left on next day after complaining to airtours we were told they tend to move at least two lots of guests a week from there !! please listen this place would only be good for single young teens who just want to drop in bed at the end of the day. there are plenty of nicer places on i drive . one family had three rooms and were charged for all three safes even though its obvious they wouldnt need them staff obviously used to complaints as they weren't very plesant.
reviews.title: Worst Experience Ever!!!
Ideal if you're looking for something Basic
reviews.text: Hi,

I have just returned from two weeks at this hotel and was slightly worried given some of the bad reviews in the past, however this hotel was fine. It is currently undergoing some improvements - we saw new air conditioning units being fitted and the outside was being painted, however this caused no problems to us.
reviews.title: Good value for money, great location

reviews.text: The two issues that i would have with this hotel is the fee that has to be paid for the use of the safe - even package holiday customers have to pay this or sign a waiver saying they refused use of the safe, which would probably ensure that the hotel would not be liable if anything were to go missing from the room. Having said this I think we should have been made aware of this by Airtours so it is not necessarily a fault of the hotel. They also had some problems with the plumbing resulting in a few cool showers, however this was not a major problem.
reviews.title: No problems with this hotel
We had a great time
reviews.text: The rooms were of a similar standard to many other Orlando hotels, they were very clean, we had fresh towels every day and they felt safe.

reviews.title: S*** HOLE
reviews.text: The pool is a little small, however it is across the road from wet n wild so this was not an issue. The deli also had a limited stock but there was a seven eleven and a walgreens only a couple of minutes away. The location is excellent, especially for Universal Studios. The free Disney shuttle was a bonus. There are I-Ride and Lynx stops right outside the hotel.
Overall I would recommend this hotel, especially as it is undergoing improvements and will likely be even better once these are finished.
reviews.title: well worth while

aka: Days Inn Orlando International Drive South Of Universal Hotel Orlando
description: Find value, warm service and an inviting atmosphere amongst Orlando’s best attractions at Days Inn Orlando / International Drive hotel. Located right on International Drive, our Orlando, Florida, hotel near Universal Studios Orlando is an ideal home base for your visit to the area.Stay full of energy at our Orlando, Florida, hotel. Our spacious and comfortable rooms help you get the rest you need, and free Wi-Fi Internet access keeps you connected away from home and the office. Enjoy conveniences like free parking with ample space for your truck, bus or RV and guest laundry facilities, and wake up each day with a refreshing morning swim in our outdoor pool. Handicapped-accessible and non-smoking rooms are available, and kids 17 and under stay free with an adult.
